rules: Rule1: Provided that the lab contains a chemical sample, then the power supply is stable.
Rule2: If the experiment is successful, then either the chemical neutralizes toxicity, or in case the power supply is not stable, the chemical does not affect animal health.
Rule3: Under the condition that the experiment is conclusive, then either the chemical neutralizes toxicity, or if the power supply is not stable, the chemical does not affect animal health.
Rule4: If the peer review verifies the results, then the journal publishes the findings.
Rule5: Either the peer review verifies the results or the team lead confirms the results.
Rule6: Provided that the team lead confirms the results, then the experiment is successful or the experiment is conclusive.
Rule7: Under the condition that the journal publishes the findings, then the researcher cites the findings.
Rule8: Whenever the researcher cites the findings, then the experiment is successful or the experiment is conclusive.
Rule9: Provided that the device detects radiation, then the radiation exceeds the safe level.
Rule10: Either the device detects radiation, or when the power supply is not stable, the alarm triggers for contamination.
Rule11: If the technician calibrates the device, then the technician adjusts the settings.
Rule12: Provided that the device analyzes the chemical sample, then the lab contains the chemical sample.
Rule13: Whenever the technician adjusts the settings, then if the device detects radiation, the system alerts about the radiation level.
Rule14: Provided that the committee approves the method, then the reviewer does not question the method.

Rule15: Under the condition that the director decides the proposal status, then if it is not the case that (if the protocol validates the method, then the previous study does not contradict the findings) implies the committee approves the method, then the committee does not reject the proposal.
Rule16: If the safety officer recommends an evacuation, then when the device detects radiation, the radiation does not exceed the safe level.
Rule17: Provided that the supervisor orders an evacuation, then if the device detects radiation, the radiation does not exceed the safe level.
Rule18: If the device tests the chemical sample, then the lab contains the chemical sample.
Rule19: Either management cancels the experiment or if the system notifies the authorities, then the emergency protocol activates.
Rule20: Whenever the analysis requires power, then the device analyzes the chemical sample or the device tests the chemical sample.
Rule21: If the sensor monitors the power level, then when the analysis does not require power, the lab does not have a backup generator.
Rule22: The sensor monitors the power level or the technician checks the power level.
Rule23: Provided that the technician checks the power level, then if the analysis does not require power, the lab does not have a backup generator.
Rule24: If it is not the case that (if the journal publishes the findings, then the experiment is successful or the experiment is conclusive), then the previous study contradicts the findings.
Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that (if the protocol validates the method, then the previous study does not contradict the findings), then the reviewer questions the method.
Rule26: Provided that it is not the case that (the safety officer recommends an evacuation or the supervisor orders an evacuation), then the system notifies the authorities.
Rule27: If it is not the case that (the safety officer recommends an evacuation or the supervisor orders an evacuation), then the emergency protocol does not activate.

Rule28: Under the condition that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that (if the protocol validates the method, then the previous study does not contradict the findings) implies the committee approves the method), then the committee rejects the proposal.
Rule29: If the analysis does not require power, then the lab has a backup generator.
Rule30: If the power supply is not stable, then the chemical affects animal health.
facts: Fact1: The technician calibrates the device.
Fact2: The protocol validates the method.
Fact3: The director decides the proposal status.
Fact4: It is not the case that the alarm triggers for contamination.
Fact5: The system does not alert about the radiation level.
Fact6: Management does not cancel the experiment.
Fact7: The chemical does not neutralize toxicity.
